questions.text: A 64-year-old male with severe pancreatitis is transferred to the ICU from an outside hospital. A report is given to the nurse that the patient has received “large-volume resuscitation.” Upon reaching the ICU, he is afebrile, tachycardic to 127, and has a BP of 120/60 mmHg. His abdomen is tense and full; he has a Foley in place but no urine in the bag. You suspect abdominal compartment syndrome (ACS). What is the mechanism of his oliguria?

options.label: A
options.text: Extrinsic compression of abdominal organs on the kidneys, leading to reduced GFR

options.label: B
options.text: Elevated renal venous pressure, leading to reduced GFR

options.label: C
options.text: Extrinsic compression of the ureters, causing an obstructive oliguric renal failure

options.label: D
options.text: Compression of the bladder, causing an obstructive oliguric renal failure .

questions.correct_answer: B. Elevated renal venous pressure, leading to reduced GFR

questions.text: A 29-year-old black woman is scheduled for incision and drainage of a breast abscess that has recurred three times despite ultrasound-guided needle drainage. The patient has a history of keloid formation and is concerned about an unsightly scar on her breast. Which of the following statements concerning wound healing is true?

options.label: A
options.text: A hypertrophic scar extends beyond the boundaries of the original wound.

options.label: B
options.text: Improvement is usually seen with keloid excision followed by intralesional steroid injection.

options.label: C
options.text: An incision placed perpendicular to the lines of natural skin tension will result in the least obvious scar.

options.label: D
options.text: Hypertrophic scars occur most commonly on the lower extremities.

questions.correct_answer: B. Improvement is usually seen with keloid excision followed by intralesional steroid injection.

questions.text: A 34-year-oldwomanisseenintheofficewitha3-month history of a left-sided neck mass and pain with mastication. On examination, a 3-cm nontender mass is present at level II; it moves laterally but not in the craniocaudal direction. CT with intravenous (IV) contrast enhancement demonstrates a 3.5-cm mass at the carotid bifurcation. A follow-up angiogram is obtained. Which of the following statements is most accurate regarding this case?

options.label: A
options.text: It represents the most common paraganglioma in the head and neck.

options.label: B
options.text: The rate of malignancy is about 40%.

options.label: C
options.text: A fine-needle aspiration biopsy(FNAB) is indicated to rule out malignancy.

options.label: D
options.text: Radiation therapy is the most effective treatment for these lesions.

questions.correct_answer: A. It represents the most common paraganglioma in the head and neck.

questions.text: Each of the following are etiologies typically associated with ischemic priapism EXCEPT:

A 24-year-old woman is a passenger in a motor vehicle collision. On arrival to the trauma bay, a chest radiograph is done (fig) A tube thoracostomy is performed, and a copious amount of bloody effusion is evacuated. Blood continues to be drained from her chest. In blunt chest trauma with hemothorax, which of the following is an indication for surgical exploration?

options.label: A
options.text: Initial chest tube output exceeding 1500 mL

options.label: B
options.text: Hourly chest tube output of up to 100 mL for three consecutive hours

questions.correct_answer: A. Initial chest tube output exceeding 1500 mL

questions.text: The patient above exhibits signs of a systemic inflammatory response. All of the following are a part of the systemic inflammatory response syndrome (SIRS) except:

options.label: C
options.text: Respiratory rate of 20 breaths/min or higher

options.label: D
options.text: 10% or greater band forms on complete blood count (CBC) with differential

questions.correct_answer: B. Pulse rate lower than 56 beats/min

questions.text: A 26-year-old man is found to be brain-dead after a gunshot wound to the head. His family consents to organ donation. Which of the following is a contraindication to organ donation?

options.label: C
options.text: History of basal cell carcinoma 5 years ago

questions.text: Which of the following is the most difficult stone composition to fragment with the following tecnique?

Shortly following CO2 insufflation, the heart rate of an otherwise healthy 50-year-old woman undergoing laparoscopic cholecystectomy decreases to 40 beats/min. What is the most likely cause of her bradycardia?
Which of the following statements regarding following technique is true is true?

options.label: A
options.text: It can reliably evaluate the retroperitoneum.

options.label: B
options.text: It can quickly detect the presence of pericardial fluid or a pleural effusion.

options.label: C
options.text: It is considered a replacement for computed tomography (CT).

options.label: D
options.text: It can reliably detect diaphragmatic injuries.

questions.correct_answer: B. It can quickly detect the presence of pericardial fluid or a pleural effusion.

questions.text: A 22-year-old man suffers a pelvic fracture during a motor vehicle crash. He is admitted to the hospital for pain control and further evaluation. He complains of inability to void several hours later and is noted to have a distended abdomen. CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis reveals a distended bladder with contrast extravasation from the urethra; there is no free fluid in the abdomen.Which of the following constitutes appropriate initial treatment?

One hour after a prolonged surgery (shown in pic),a70-year-oldman with mild coronary artery disease experiences bradycardia, hypertension, confusion, nausea, and headache. What is the most likely cause?

A 14-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department with a 4-h history of acute, severe left scrotal pain. Examination reveals a high-riding left testicle with severe pain on palpation. Urinalysis does not reveal any evidence of red or white blood cells. Which of the following is the treatment of choice at this point?

options.label: C
options.text: Doppler examination of testicular blood flow

questions.text: Which of the following is an absolute indication for open repair of blunt bladder rupture injury?

options.label: A
options.text: Significant extraperitoneal bladder rupture with extravasation of contrast agent into the scrotum

options.label: B
options.text: Significant extraperitoneal bladder rupture with gross hematuria

options.label: D
options.text: Significant extraperitoneal bladder rupture associated with pelvic fracture requiring treatment by external fixation

questions.correct_answer: D. Significant extraperitoneal bladder rupture associated with pelvic fracture requiring treatment by external fixation

questions.text: A 17-year-old female presents after a motor vehicle crash and is in hemorrhagic shock. A massive transfusion protocol is triggered. What is the optimal ratio in damage control resuscitation?
questions.correct_answer: B. 1 plasma:1 platelet:1 red blood cell

questions.text: With regard following energy devices, what is correct statement

options.label: C
options.text: Bipolar uses AC, while monopolar uses DC.

options.label: D
options.text: Bipolar uses DC, while monopolar uses AC.

questions.text: A 32-year-old male presents after being assaulted by a bat to his head, face, and torso. He opens his eyes to sternal rub, localizes to pain, and is only making sounds. What is this patient’s GCS?

A 37-year-old female comes in with a stab wound to the right chest just lateral to the sternal border. HR is 130 beats/min, blood pressure is 74/58 mmHg, and jugular venous distention is noted on examination with muffled heart sounds. Which option provides the appropriate diagnosis and treatment?
A 65-year-old male undergoes parotidectomy for a parotid neoplasm. Which of the following is true regarding parotidectomy?

options.label: A
options.text: Frey’s syndrome is caused by injury to the greater auricular nerve and presents with sweating and reddening of the skin during meals.

options.label: B
options.text: A common complication of parotidectomy is injury to the greater auricular nerve, which causes perioral numbness.

options.label: C
options.text: Frey’s syndrome is the result of an aberrant innervation of cutaneous sweat glands by postganglionic parasympathetic fibers.

options.label: D
options.text: The parotid gland is divided into superficial and deep lobes by the facial vein.

questions.correct_answer: C. Frey’s syndrome is the result of an aberrant innervation of cutaneous sweat glands by postganglionic parasympathetic fibers.

questions.text: A 25-year-old patient has been in the burn intensive care unit (ICU ) intubated and sedated for 2weeks after 60% TBSA burn. He suddenly develops hypotension, tachycardia, and melena. What type of surgical problem is this patient most likely to have?
The following are extrarenal manifestations of following condition seen on CT scan EXCEPT:
The voiding pattern most often seen in a girl with an ectopic ureter is:
With regard to breast carcinoma in men, which statement is true?

options.label: A
options.text: It is detected most commonly in men aged 60 to 70 years.

options.label: C
options.text: It is commonly associated with a mutation in the BRCA1 gene.

options.label: D
options.text: The prognosis is worse stage for stage than for women.

questions.correct_answer: A. It is detected most commonly in men aged 60 to 70 years.

questions.text: A 57-year-old woman with a 1.5-cm infiltrating ductal carcinoma and a clinically negative axilla is found to be ER negative, PR negative, and HER-2/neu positive. She comes to your office to discuss treatment options. What would you recommend?

options.label: B
options.text: Wide local excision, radiation therapy, and tamoxifen

options.label: C
options.text: Simple mastectomy, SLNB, trastuzumab (Herceptin), and tamoxifen

options.label: D
options.text: Wide local excision, SLNB, radiation therapy, and adjuvant chemotherapy with trastuzumab

questions.correct_answer: D. Wide local excision, SLNB, radiation therapy, and adjuvant chemotherapy with trastuzumab

questions.text: A patient with a SCC of the left lower alveolus undergoes a segmental mandibulectomy of a 6-cm segment of bone. Which reconstructive option is the most appropriate?
Neurogenic shock is characterized by the presence o
With regard to the current therapy for stage I and stage II breast cancer, which statement is true?

options.label: A
options.text: The Halsted radical mastectomy has resulted in a cure rate superior to that of other surgical treatment options.

options.label: B
options.text: Tumor genomic testing assists in making decisions regarding the benefit of chemotherapy in early-stage (stages I–II) ER-positive breast cancers.

options.label: C
options.text: Node-negative patients who undergo modified radical mastectomy have a survival advantage over those who choose lumpectomy, SLNB, and radiation therapy.

options.label: D
options.text: There is no role for nipple-sparing mastectomy in the treatment of invasive cancers.

questions.correct_answer: B. Tumor genomic testing assists in making decisions regarding the benefit of chemotherapy in early-stage (stages I–II) ER-positive breast cancers.

questions.text: Which of the following patients is considered an appropriate candidate for breast-preserving therapy?

options.label: A
options.text: A 40-year-old woman with a history of active scleroderma and a T1N0 infiltrating ductal carcinoma of her right breast

options.label: B
options.text: A 45-year-old woman with a T1N1 infiltrating ductal carcinoma of her left breast after lumpectomy, negative surgical margins, and axillary lymph node dissection with 2 of 12 lymph nodes positive

options.label: C
options.text: A 37-year-old woman with a T2N0 infiltrating ductal carcinoma of her right breast who has a history of Hodgkin disease treated with 36 Gy to a mantle field 15 years earlier

questions.correct_answer: B. A 45-year-old woman with a T1N1 infiltrating ductal carcinoma of her left breast after lumpectomy, negative surgical margins, and axillary lymph node dissection with 2 of 12 lymph nodes positive

questions.text: With regard to Hashimoto’s thyroiditis, which of the following is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: he majority of patients are transiently hypothyroid but with time return to a euthyroid state.

options.label: C
options.text: Radioactive iodine is useful in the treatment of Hashimoto’s thyroiditis.

options.label: D
options.text: Thyroid microsomal antibodies are detected in the serum of patients.

questions.correct_answer: D. Thyroid microsomal antibodies are detected in the serum of patients.

questions.text: During a laparoscopic appendectomy, a large bowel injury was caused during trocar placement with spillage of bowel contents into the abdomen. What class of surgical wound is this?
With regard to the pathologic features of thyroid carcinoma, which of the following is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Psammoma bodies are a feature of medullary thyroid carcinoma (MTC).

options.label: B
options.text: Hürthle cell carcinoma represents a subtype of anaplastic thyroid carcinoma.

options.label: C
options.text: Amyloid deposits are a characteristic of papillary thyroid carcinoma.

options.label: D
options.text: Nuclear grooves and inclusions are a characteristic feature of papillary thyroid carcinoma.

questions.correct_answer: D. Nuclear grooves and inclusions are a characteristic feature of papillary thyroid carcinoma.

questions.text: The most common diagnosis leading to a heart transplant is
What is the most common melanoma in patients with dark skin?
What is an indication for the surgical repair of the following condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Growth of more than 5 mm in 1 year

options.label: C
options.text: Growth of more than 5 mm in 6 months

options.label: D
options.text: An aneurysm of any size in a patient with hypertension

questions.correct_answer: C. Growth of more than 5 mm in 6 months

questions.text: Which is a true statement about the DeBakey and Stanford classifications of aortic dissection?

options.label: A
options.text: A dissection can be both Stanford class A and DeBakey type II.

options.label: B
options.text: Stanford class A dissections are treated with aggressive medical management of blood pressure.

options.label: C
options.text: DeBakey type III dissections are proximal to the left subclavian artery.

options.label: D
options.text: Stanford class B dissections are always considered surgical emergencies

questions.correct_answer: A. A dissection can be both Stanford class A and DeBakey type II.

questions.text: Regarding Raynaud disease or phenomenon, which of the following statements is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: It is characterized by sequential phases of pallor, cyanosis, and rubor in the upper extremities that are initiated by exposure to heat or emotional stress.

options.label: B
options.text: It is seen most frequently in elderly women.

options.label: C
options.text: It is characterized by a pathologic mechanism that involves vasospasm with a reduction in dermal circulation.

questions.correct_answer: C. It is characterized by a pathologic mechanism that involves vasospasm with a reduction in dermal circulation.

questions.text: The CEAP classification is a formal system for classifying venous disease based on the Clinical picture, Etiology of the disease, Anatomic distribution, and Pathophysiology of venous disease. A patient with telangiectasias on physical examination of the lower extremity would be classified with which clinical stage?
Which of the following is true regarding the following tumour of breast

options.label: A
options.text: Present in older women when compared to fibroadenomas

options.label: B
options.text: Are at a high risk of recurrence approximating 20%

questions.text: A professional singer has a left thyroid lobectomy for a large thyroid nodule with compression symptoms. Post- operatively, she notices she is having trouble hitting some notes and projecting her voice. The ligation of which vessel resulted in this nerve injury?
A 42-year-old woman presents with bulging eyes and symptoms of hyperthyroidism including palpitations, heat intolerance, and anxiety. What will an iodine uptake scan show?

options.label: A
options.text: No uptake in the thyroid gland

options.label: B
options.text: High uniform uptake throughout both lobes of the thyroid

options.label: C
options.text: High multifocal uptake within both lobes of the thyroid

options.label: D
options.text: High unifocal uptake in the right upper lobe

questions.correct_answer: B. High uniform uptake throughout both lobes of the thyroid
